thread.title: Dez Bryant isn't first Cowboys WR with a pet monkey
thread.title_full: Dez Bryant isn't first Cowboys WR with a pet monkey | Dallas Morning News

author: David Moore
title: Dez Bryant isn't first Cowboys WR with a pet monkey
text:
Dez Bryant is one of the best receivers in Cowboys history.
But he's not the first to own a pet monkey.
The Pro Bowl receiver created a stir when he posted a picture of his pet, named Dallas Bryant, on Instagram. This comes 20 years after another monkey hung out in the Cowboys locker room.
Literally.
Oronde Gadsden played for the Cowboys for just one season in 1995. But his pet monkey, Malik, was often seen at the club's Valley Ranch facility wearing a diaper and waving a bottle.
"He would sit on Oronde's shoulder with his tail wrapped around his neck,'' remembers Nate Newton, a Pro Bowl left guard on that team. "He was really well behaved. It's not like he would be running around the locker room and stuff.
"A lot of the guys really liked him.''
Not all of them did. Malik would hang from the side of Gadsden's stall, located at the walkway from the dining room to the locker room, and would startle players as they walked to their lockers.
Newton was one of the players that never warmed to Malik.
"He asked me once if I wanted to hold his monkey,'' Newton said of Gadsden. "I didn't want any part of that.''
It's unclear if Dallas Bryant has made an appearance in the Cowboys locker room. But one of the songs played during Thursday's practice was "Shake Me Like A Monkey'' by the Dave Matthews Band.
